Okay one quick thing I wanted to point out about the potato gun,
it has to do with pressure, volume, and velocity.
As the propellant ignites and pressure causes the potato to move down the barrel,
when it does this the volume behind the potato expands.
As the volume increases, if the burn rate doesn't keep up, sometimes the pressure can start to decrease.
Different types of potato gun propellant  burn at different rates. Depending on the length of the barrel,
if the volume expands to much, the pressure inside the chamber can actually dip below atmospheric pressure.
The pressure can dip so low in fact that it can condense water vapor out of the air.
